moves.1. e4 c5 2. f4 Nc6 3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 e6 5: When making this move I realized the black could eventually play ... c4; for now this threat is hypothetical due to B:c4
moves.18... Na5 19. Rac1:
I completely forgot about the ... c4 and my opponent promptly reminded me about it :) 
The white are losing their bishop...
moves.19... c4 20. Qg3 Bxa3 21. Rce1 Bf8 22. Q: I don't think this move is good, probably ... f5 would be better
Again, the white are playing without a bishop, however I was able to consolidate 5 pieces on the king's side.
moves.27... Ne3 28. Ng3 Nd5 29. Ne4: This is a great place for the knight.
moves.29... Bg7 30. h4 Bxa4: The black are now a bishop and a pawn up!
moves.31. h5: Using the fact that the black can't play g5 now.
moves.32... gxh5 33. gxh6 Bxh6 34. Qxh5 Bg7 35: Too passive. Maybe it was time to give some material back trying to diffuse white's attack.
moves.36. f5: Now the white's attack is unstoppable.
39... B:f6 would lose even faster:

40.N:f6+ N:f6
41. Rg5+ Kf8
42.Qh8+ with a checkmate to follow.
Last touch. The white attacks the f7 pawn and the knight on a5.
moves.45... Ke7 46. exf7 Kxf6 47. f8=Q+ Ke6 48: The black has won a bishop early on but underestimated white's initiative on the king's side.
